locutie.beschrijving: The sermon explores the biblical paradox of 'holy dread' and 'grace' through the stories of Gideon, Peter, and a contemporary short story. It defines God's character as perfect justice and unconditional love.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Strong narrative exegesis; focuses on the psychological and existential weight of the encounters rather than technical word studies.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily asserting the nature of God's presence, with a shift toward promising (commissive) in the final movements.
voorbeelden: The glory of the Lord and the fear of the Lord go together.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To move the hearer from a 'bland' theology to a state of 'holy dread' that finds comfort in the 'Fear not' of the Gospel.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit; the sermon speaks of an 'irruption of grace' which suggests the Spirit's work, though the Spirit is not named.

voorbeelden: The story tells of two adolescent boys.
The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom.
God is opposed to our selfishness.
Notice that in the Old Testament...
I was amazed when I looked it up.
I think this is supposed to be funny.
The next words that you hear will be: Fear not.
He is for us in ways that we can scarcely imagine.
commissieven.kwaliteit: High theological quality but often framed as general truths rather than direct personal promises.

declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher relies on the authority of the quoted Scripture rather than speaking *in persona Christi*.

indicatoren: Extensive retelling of the Mark Richard story.
Theological definitions of justice and love.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes an observer of 'grace' as a concept rather than a participant in an encounter.

missende_elementen: Direct address of the promise to the specific congregation
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Intellectual agreement without the 'event' of being addressed by God.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Strongly biblical but often mediated through the third person or past tense examples.
voorbeelden: The God who terrifies is also the one who loves us for all eternity.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address used primarily in the application and the final promise.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used to place the hearer in the hospital ward or before the judgment.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Dominates the exegesis and the storytelling.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a literary distance that requires a strong 'bridge' to the present.

verleden_tijd.gebruik: Biblical narratives and the New Yorker story.

actueel_present.gebruik: The 'irruption of grace' in the subway/daily life.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: The sermon avoids moralistic 'Assertive -> Directive' traps.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Moves from Assertive (Theology of Fear) to Commissive (The Promise of Love).
voorbeelden: Grace is terrifying... Yet God is for us.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Count yourself blessed... for the next words you hear will be Fear Not.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon is a masterful piece of theological reflection that moves toward a promise, but it functions more as a 'testimony about' the nature of God than a 'sacramental event' where God speaks directly.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The attributes of God toward us are perfect justice and unconditional love.
sterke_punten.effect: Provides a robust foundation for faith.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The story of Gideon takes up a large portion of the text in the 3rd person.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It becomes an event in the final third when the preacher addresses the 'messed up' reality of the hearer.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The preacher remains a 'describer' of grace more than a 'dispenser' of it.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: God is the subject of the sentences, but rarely the direct speaker through the preacher.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: The preacher acts as a witness/teacher.
tekstueel_bewijs: If I were to read aloud...
I think this is supposed to be funny.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: No explicit mention of the Holy Spirit.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicitly left to the 'irruption of grace'.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, the sermon aims to be a 'moment of grace'.
tekstueel_bewijs: There may suddenly come an irruption of grace.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Too many 'is' and 'was' verbs; needs more 'I promise' or 'God declares' force.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The God who terrifies is also the one who loves us.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: This terrifying God says to you now: I love you for all eternity.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a fact about God to an act of God.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is often buried in the narrative of others (Gideon/Peter).
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Use the 2nd person singular/plural more aggressively in the climax.
voorbeeldzinnen: To you, in your mess, Christ says: Fear not.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Interject the 'you' into the Gideon story.
voorbeeldzinnen: Like Gideon, you are hiding in your own winepress of fear.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The balance is actually quite good.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Maintain the current indicative-heavy approach but strengthen the illocutionary force of the indicative.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A beautiful, literary sermon that successfully avoids moralism but could benefit from a more daring sacramental 'I' in the proclamation of the Gospel.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the 'appeal' (Directive); SAT reveals the sermon's power is actually in the 'Commissive' (The Promise).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric would praise the 'Birds' illustration; SAT asks if that illustration actually *does* something to the hearer's status before God.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT identifies that the 'Fear not' is the only truly Declarative moment that changes the hearer's reality.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: High for teaching, low for encounter.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: Fear not: for, behold, I bring you good tidings of great joy.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Maximum; this is the sacramental core.

appendices.notities: The sermon is highly 'literary' which often correlates with a high constative surplus, as the preacher 'paints a picture' rather than 'performing an act'.
